data.title: Projects permanently removed off project manager if drive not mounted
data.body:
Godot 2.1.1 - Windows 10
I have my list of projects in the project list including one on a network drive (T).
If T drive isn't mounted when Godot is started, the project entries are permanently removed from the project list. Mounting the drive then restarting Godot doesn't make them reappear - they have to be reimported.
I would expect them to still be listed and fail to load if clicked. 
I know you can scan for them again, but I consider this a bug.

data.title: Fix #7098 by not accepting right clicks while dragging the range
data.body:
I hope this breaks nothing else :wink: 
Fixes #7098.

data.title: expose EditorAutoloadSettings to gdscript
data.body:
**Autoload for plugins**


**feature description** :
have the ability for plugins to setup their own autoload scripts.

if I install and activate plugin "test" for my project... test should also setup its own autoload script.

to do this we need to expose EditorAutoloadSettings to gdscript

data.title: ConfigFile - end of file bug causes infinite loop
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro 64-bit, Godot 2.1-2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Loading multiple *.cfg files sometimes causes "Not responding" (game hangs up on splashscreen, possible infinite loop). There must be something wrong with ConfigFile and Windows eof implementation (I can't reproduce that on Linux), because it can be fixed by adding empty line at the end of all loaded *.cfg files.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/c05ff0577fd9cc39a6968e65743f7d7da711bfe2/core/io/config_file.cpp#L156

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Prepare some valid *.cfg files without empty lines at the end. 
2. Load them all at once as in example http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/classes/class_configfile.html

data.title: Able to change visibility when ancestor node is hidden
You cannot load a vehicle wheel externally from a different scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.1, Fedora 25

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I am trying to make cars customizable and have the chassis/wheels be swappable, so I tried to load tires into a scene and get it to work however it appears like you cannot load vehicle wheels from a different scene and have the physics still apply

**Steps to reproduce:**
You could manually make a scene that has a vehicle wheel, and a graphical mesh if you want something visible; load it into a separate scene containing a vehicle and attach it as a child. You could also import my project into Godot and see the issue for yourself.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://notabug.org/bkeys/DMUX

data.title: Loading .xm files into EventPlayer via file dialogue crashes Editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 - 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If you attempt to load .xm files into an EventPlayer node via Godot's file dialogue in the Editor via the EventPlayer's Stream property, Godot crashes

I have even managed to get Godot to crash by dragging the file from the FileSystem panel into the code editor, however I have been unable to reproduce this

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create EventPlayer node
Attempt to load in .xm file via Godot's file dialogue in the Stream property
Observe crashing

data.title: .mod playback broken in EventPlayer
data.body:

Windows 7 - 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Playing .mod files with EventPlayer causes the audio to be extremely distorted

**Steps to reproduce:**

**(WARNING: Low volume is recommended)**

Create an EventPlayer node
Load .mod file into EventPlayer via Stream property
Tick Autoplay
Test scene

data.title: Close file without saving changes
data.body:
Found on Godot 2.1.1, 64 bits, Windows 10

![save_changes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/21505326/864efd12-cc66-11e6-91e7-2cb514e6e43e.png)

Minor usability issue:
If i click cancel, the file doesn't close. If I click Ok, the file is saved and closed.
I would like to have "Yes", "No" and "Cancel" options, where "No" closes without saving the file.

macOS Sierra 10.12.1, Godot 2.1 stable

Export with release keystore but fail with error:"'jarsigner' returned with error #1"
I tried adding -sigalg MD5withRSA -keyalg RSA to generate keystore as #1957 but didn't help.

But signed with debugkey is OK

data.title: Scroll horizontally with mouse wheel when horizontal enabled only
CollisionShape2D scale() not working?
data.body:
This is my node hierarchy:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3944421/21488277/f195d05c-cbdd-11e6-832f-8249b5527fd5.png)

```
Hierarchy:
RigidBody2D
  Sprite
  CollisionShape2D
```

I'm trying to scale down the Rigidbody2D node (Flame node):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3944421/21488293/4320b7a2-cbde-11e6-94cb-3bd6f93e3f1f.png)

This is how I'm doing it. Sprite nodes scales down when I scale its parent down, but the Collision node does not.

Which is strange, because , if I do this in the graphical editor, everything scales perfectly fine, including the CollisionShape2D.

So I realise that I can't change CollisionShape2D size with the scale() method.

But how else can I scale a node with a CollisionShape2D?, I tried to to code within the CollisionShape2D node, it doesn't work either. So what can I do to dynamically shrink the Node with a collision?

Someone on IIRC told me to swap with 2 collision, but is that really the only way?

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

[Fire.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/673461/Fire.zip)

data.title: Fix ColorPicker not correctly updating after pasting hex html color
data.body: Fixes #7365 (ColorPicker not correctly updating after pasting hex html color)

data.title: NavigationMeshInstance: DebugMesh is not updated on change
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

- Godot 2.1.1
- master-branch  c798ff1 and earlier

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
DebugMesh is not updated if you change the navigation mesh calling _NavigationMeshInstance::set_navigation_mesh(...)_

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Create a Navigation node and a NavigationMeshInstance child
2. Initialize NavigationMeshInstance with calling _set_navigation_mesh(navmsh1)_ where _navmsh1_ is a NavigationMesh
3. Enable Navigation Debugging with calling _get_tree().set_debug_navigation_hint(true)_
4. Look at the rendered NavigationMesh when running a game
5. Change the NavigationMesh with calling _set_navigation_mesh(navmsh2)_ where _navmsh2_ is another NavigationMesh
6. No change in the rendered NavigationMesh when running a game

**Possible Fix**
Some code like:
```
if(debug_view && navmesh.is_valid()) {
    debug_view->cast_to<MeshInstance>()->set_mesh( navmesh->get_debug_mesh() );
}
```
in
```
void NavigationMeshInstance::set_navigation_mesh(const Ref<NavigationMesh>& p_navmesh)
```
should fix it?

data.title: Godot GUI bug on Windows 10 when I click on "Play Custom Scene (Shift+Ctrl+F5)
data.body:

If you look at the image you see what I mean, between the output Window and Code editor, you see 2 button: Open and Cancel. Which is from the "Play Custom Scene Shift Ctrl F5". I've absolutely no idea what I can do against it.

**Steps to reproduce:**
It seems it only happens on my laptop so far, and not on my desktop, and when it happens on my laptop there was most of the time some compile error.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
I don't think it's relevant, but it who knows. It's just me testing out few things with Godot.
[Fire.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/672244/Fire.zip)

data.title: cannot change visibility of child node if parent node is hidden
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you are trying to use the eye icon in the hierarchy to change the visibility of a node that is a child of an invisible node you get an error message saying "This item cannot be made visible because the parent is hidden. Unhide the parent first.".
It's fine that there is a warning for people who would wonder why there are no visible changes, but it should be possible to change the value nevertheless. E.g. I might have a complex scene with two states in it of which one is always hidden. It should be possible to switch those states without having to unhide the root node first.

Apart from that changing the Visible-Flag in the CanvasItem section of the inspector works, but doesn't update the eye-symbol in the hierarchy.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new scene.
Create a root node of type Node2D.
Create a child node of type Node2D.
Hide the root node.
a) Try to hide the child node.
b) Unset the Visible-flag in the inspector.

data.title: str function error when extracting HTML5 or Linux binary version
data.body:
Hi,

I started to develop a small project with Godot Engine v2.0.3.stable.official version in Arch Linux ( 4.8.11.1 x64_86 ). 

I used a label and a button. When the button is triggered, any numeric value as **string** will be written in label via setText. When i use str function to convert the numeric value to string, it works on Godot Editor. After the project is exported, it does not work in browser (HTML5) and as Linux binary file, str function gives 'you can not convert bool to string' weird error when it runs. Then, i use String constructor instead of str function, at this time it does not work on Godot Editor, but works on browser ( HTML5 ) and as Linux binary, there is no error. 

[This](https://github.com/borcun/godot-sample/blob/master/GoCalculator/calculator.gd) is my GDScript link.
The related issue is in 73 and 74 lines.

Thank you so much.

data.title: Duplicating a tree with animation breaks the original tree.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, Godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When a scene tree is duplicated and contains an animation, it seems it tries to fix the new animation to match the new node. It also seems to change the original animation to match the new node, thus breaking it. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a subtree in a scene which contains an animation, duplicate it.

data.title: Improve ColorPicker to be like Photoshop's (Can switch vertical slider / gradient bg depending on selected color component)
data.body:
This is just a "nice to have" feature request.

The current ColorPicker is nice, but Photoshop's color picker has a few nice features I'd like to highlight.

(The following images are from Photoshop's color picker)

Here the gradient area selects Saturation and Brightness (Value) while the vertical slider selects Hue. This is similar to what Godot's ColorPicker looks like now.
Note that the vertical slider is selecting Hue because the H radio button is selected. .
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/357737/21469949/74e9bd74-caa3-11e6-9720-d3d14c7ca6e3.png)

Now maybe I like the color but want to adjust the brightness a bit so I select the B radio button to adjust the color brightness on the vertical slider. The vertical slider lets me easily pick the brightness I want. I also have a nice Hue/Saturation gradient selection area to the left.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/357737/21469956/8875c464-caa3-11e6-8bcf-1b3fd2ac4de7.png)

I'm thinking maybe it needs more Red so I choose the R radio button to again adjust the vertical slider and see what adding more red to the color would do:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/357737/21469959/d68cd156-caa3-11e6-86d8-22a53f1d786b.png)

I find this flexibility extremely useful in helping to pick the right color.

Additionally Photoshop's color picker has the previous color (current) for easy comparison.

Of course the CMYK and Lab options aren't needed for game dev.

data.title: When pasting hex (html) color value, ColorPicker doesn't update itself properly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot master self built from commit afbe013ba12d68f20ef1dfe2d7a895105a440bd9 on Windows 10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When pasting hex color value, the hue/shade+saturation selectors above don't update. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Open a Color Picker
- Paste a hex color value into the # field and hit Enter
- Notice the above part doesn't update (the crosshair position and it's background)

**How to fix:**

Change ```_update_color()``` here:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/afbe013ba12d68f20ef1dfe2d7a895105a440bd9/scene/gui/color_picker.cpp#L165

to ```set_color(color)``` so that everything gets updated properly.

data.title: Fix bottom panel visibility on play
data.body:
**Before this patch:**
When you click play button, "Output" console always open, even if the debugger
or other panel was open. This is very annoying IMO.

**After this patch:**
Let the users choose what panel they want, if the output console is open, then
will stay opened, if the debugger is open, it will stay opened (only if you checked the option in the script panel), etc. 

**I added a new option called "run/always_open_output_on_play" setted to true to keep the old behavior too.**

Verifying Network IDs of the callers of received RPCs
data.body:
There has to be a way for checking who the caller is to act accordingly.
It would be great if it could be done by using a different keyword in place of "remote" for when you want your function to only be executable if the caller has ID equal to 1.

data.title: Feature proposal - Grease Pencil
data.body:
Hey guys...I was thinking (inb4 here we go again) what if Godot had a Grease Pencil to write some notes in the scene. I really like to use it in Blender to take some notes about a specific thing.

and I think it would be awesome to have this in Godot to sketch some game bahaviours and systems, or note comment something someone did (good or bad).

It could be a node that only renders on editor. Is it viable?
![15723524_1140299556023729_7470708009920256826_o](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10171059/21464215/b479d66e-c95d-11e6-807d-c9e626277c54.jpg)

data.title: Comment system for documentation...
data.body:
Hi, I'm new with Godot, and I love open-source. Godot is the best thing ever that happened for me as someone who is trying to make 2D games for the first time. At first I didn't liked GDscript, but after using it for few days I'm starting to enjoy it.

My biggest problem with GDscripting is the lack of useful information/details in the web documentation.

When I search for .scale() I wish the website documentation could give me more information than this:
> void scale ( Vector2 ratio )
> Apply the ratio scale to the 2D node, according to its current scale value.

Maybe for you guys this is informative enough, but for me it isn't, and I also don't see the difference between scale() and set_scale().

I'd love to read other people's opinion/experience/examples about certain function/topics/tutorials. For now I'm just following Youtube tutorials till I eventually find a video where someone shows how to properly use Scale() function.

I've read that you guys don't like "solutions" from users. But this is a idea for a feature request.

I really wish to see comment section for each API/function in Godot, something similar as PHP's documentation, A "guestbook" where people can share their experience and example codes with a simple comment. Integrate it with an upvotes and downvotes system, just like PHP's documentation to get most useful comments at top, and least useful stays bottom.

That way it's very easier and less scarier for people to contribute and talk about certain functions of Godot scripting API. Instead of going through Youtube video tutorials and spamming Reddit with questions.
